topics.body:
I may be meh on Kantai Collection, mainly cause I'm not into dating sim games to be honest(reason why is I'm a busy person and dropping forty hours for a dating sim I don't have that sort of time), but there is one thing I like about it that definitely has my interest.
*pulls lever from ceiling causing mass of manga to fall from ceiling*
*in a muffled voice* "so much porn"

If someone asks, "well why do you dislike kantai"/"why don't you like dating sims" I actually don't dislike them; I just have way to much shit to do.  I barely have enough time for a match of league once every two or three days and have four games still on my backburner.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/541632716368721268710100#post_541632716368721268710100
The problem with Dating Sims for me at least is that I need them to be good, really good. Otherwise it feels like a slog with no reward or minimal reward depending on how much and how freaky the porn part is.

An example of a good one I'd say is Sayya No Uta, which is fuck mothering terrifying.
topics.author: 4f41ee04945b701c41002af7

topics.body:
"@gasmaskangel":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54163449636872295e540100#post_54163449636872295e540100
Ironically even though I like perverted stuff and pandering stuff I don't actually get a lot of time to play games like those.  The last game in the pandering to your wank that I played was Monster Girl Quest.

Why haven't I been able to play as many games?  Game Design is hard.  Why is it so hard?  Cause a single mistake can completely fuck your game.  I spent two hours trying to find out where a error was in what I was working on today and turns out one of the variables for the movement was a positive instead of a negative so I was spending two hours trying to find a typo that completely stopped me stone cold steve austin.  Shit's hard.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
